title: Strictly Come Dancing week 6 - Judi James on the body language. 'Success is Michelle and Giovanni moving in a sexy single unit'
text:
There were some moments of genuine horror on Strictly’s Hallowe'en special over the weekend that weren’t anything to do with the zombie make-up and rivers of fake blood.

Hearing Janette Manrara’s scream as her partner, last week's hero Will Bayley, hit the decks and remained part-curled there in agony after a leg injury during rehearsals was both horrific and sad and just had to make us question how far we want to see some of our celebs go to win a TV dance competition.

Motsi's misery

Then there was judge Motsi Mabuse’s grim-looking mouth-clamp at the end of the show. Did Motsi really perform a non-verbal chorus of disapproval with her facial expression as Catherine Tyldesley did her last waltz...
description: There were some moments of genuine horror on Strictly’s Hallowe'en special over the weekend that weren’t anything to do with the zombie make-up and rivers of fake blood.
